para.text: Within 120 days after October 8, 2016, each school shall meet the requirements of § 7-2371.02 and:
Establish procedures for responding to a medical emergency involving cardiac arrest, including the appropriate use of CPR and an AED;
Have at least one AED on-site at the school;
Have, in coordination with the Department of General Services, a maintenance schedule established for each AED that is in accordance with the manufacturer's guidelines and includes:
Periodic testing;
Periodic inspection; and
Annual maintenance;
Ensure that each AED at the school is appropriate for use on children and adults;

Have had the following individuals successfully complete a CPR and AED program; provided, that individuals newly hired for the following positions shall be required to successfully complete a CPR and AED program within 60 days after their hire date:
Athletic coach, coaching assistant, and athletic trainer;
Athletic director;
Team or game physician;
School nurse; and
Every anticipated AED user employed by the school, as designated by the school;
Require that at least one individual trained in a CPR and AED program be present during the school's hours of operation and during any athletic activity; and
Inform all school employees, at least annually, of the location of each AED in the school.
The Mayor shall:
Establish baseline requirements and guidelines for a CPR and AED program;

Approve each existing CPR and AED program that the Mayor determines meets or exceeds the baseline requirements and guidelines for a CPR and AED program, and any new CPR and AED programs established pursuant to this subchapter; provided, that the Mayor shall approve the existing programs listed in § 7-2371.02(a)(1) and the program offered by the Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department pursuant to § 5-401(b-1), as meeting the requirements of this section;
Require each school to maintain a written record of the periodic testing, inspection, and maintenance of each AED; and
Require the successful completion of a CPR and AED program by each employee in a position listed in subsection (a)(5) of this section.
A CPR and AED program may be conducted by a private or public entity.
